name: python-quality-loop
description: Iterative Python development workflow with Manager-Doer orchestration, quality gates, GitOps integration, Unix philosophy composition patterns, Knuth's dogfooding philosophy, and consistent code layout standards. Provides workflow orchestration, role-based skills (Manager, Developer, Reviewer), package research, playground exploration, llmtxt documentation, and automated quality enforcement.
compatibility: Designed for Claude Code. Requires git for GitOps features.

skills.name: workflow-manager
skills.description: Manager role for oversight, quality gates, and decisions

skills.name: workflow-developer
skills.description: Developer role for implementation and testing

skills.name: workflow-reviewer
skills.description: Reviewer role for independent quality evaluation

skills.name: gitops-workflow
skills.description: Git operations, branching, and PR workflows

skills.name: package-research
skills.description: Research existing packages before implementing. Guides systematic package discovery, evaluation, and build vs compose decisions.

skills.name: llmtxt-generation

skills.name: unix-philosophy
skills.description: Unix philosophy principles for Python development. Composition over reimplementation, small focused modules, leveraging existing tools.

skills.name: playground-exploration
skills.description: Playground-driven development using Knuth's dogfooding philosophy. Discover features through real usage, find missing functionality, and convert experiments to tests.

skills.name: python-layout
skills.description: Python project and module structure guidance. Consistent conventions for project structure, module organization, file naming, and code organization within files.
